screenId.description: The screen id of the element

BlankScreen.description:
A warning that Robo encountered a screen that was mostly blank; this may
indicate a problem with the app.

EncounteredLoginScreen.description: Additional details about encountered login screens.

distinctScreens.description: Number of encountered distinct login screens.

nameOfGoogleLibrary.description: The name of the Google-provided library with the non-SDK API dependency.

PendingGoogleUpdateInsight.description:
This insight indicates that the hidden API usage originates from a
Google-provided library. Users need not take any action.

IosAppCrashed.description: Additional details for an iOS app crash.

stackTrace.description:
The stack trace, if one is available.
Optional.

The stack trace of the native crash.
Optional.

NativeCrash.description: Additional details for a native crash.

NonSdkApiUsageViolationReport.description: Contains a summary and examples of non-sdk API usage violations.

targetSdkVersion.description: Specifies the API Level on which the application is designed to run.

exampleApis.description: Examples of the detected API usages.

uniqueApis.description: Total number of unique Non-SDK API's accessed.

minSdkVersion.description: Minimum API level required for the application to run.

PerformedGoogleLogin.description: A notification that Robo signed in with Google.

PerformedMonkeyActions.description: A notification that Robo performed some monkey actions.

totalActions.description: The total number of monkey actions performed during the crawl.

FatalException.description: Additional details for a fatal exception.

stackTrace.description:
The stack trace of the fatal exception.
Optional.

LauncherActivityNotFound.description: Failed to find the launcher activity of an app.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource that was unused.

UnusedRoboDirective.description: Additional details of an unused robodirective.

invocationCount.description: The total number of times this API was observed to have been called.

exampleStackTraces.description: Example stack traces of this API being called.

apiSignature.description: The signature of the Non-SDK API

list.description: Which list this API appears on

insights.description: Optional debugging insights for non-SDK API violations.

NonSdkApi.description:
A non-sdk API and examples of it being called along with other metadata
See
https://developer.android.com/distribute/best-practices/develop/restrictions-non-sdk-interfaces

UsedRoboDirective.description: Additional details of a used Robo directive.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource that was used.

CrashDialogError.description: Crash dialog was detected during the test execution

crashPackage.description: The name of the package that caused the dialog.

InsufficientCoverage.description: A warning that Robo did not crawl potentially important parts of the app.

NonSdkApiInsight.description: Non-SDK API insights (to address debugging solutions).

pendingGoogleUpdateInsight.description:
An insight indicating that the hidden API usage originates from a
Google-provided library.

upgradeInsight.description:
An insight indicating that the hidden API usage originates from the
use of a library that needs to be upgraded.

exampleTraceMessages.description:
Optional sample stack traces, for which this insight applies (there
should be at least one).

matcherId.description:
A unique ID, to be used for determining the effectiveness of this
particular insight in the context of a matcher. (required)

screenStateId.description: The screen state id of the element

screenId.description: The screen id of the element

depth.description: The depth of the screen element

UIElementTooDeep.description: A warning that the screen hierarchy is deeper than the recommended threshold.

NonSdkApiUsageViolation.description: Additional details for a non-sdk API usage violation.

uniqueApis.description: Total number of unique hidden API's accessed.

apiSignatures.description: Signatures of a subset of those hidden API's.

UpgradeInsight.description:
This insight is a recommendation to upgrade a given library to the specified
version, in order to avoid dependencies on non-SDK APIs.

upgradeToVersion.description:
The suggested version to upgrade to.
Optional: In case we are not sure which version solves this problem

packageName.description: The name of the package to be upgraded.

StartActivityNotFound.description: User provided intent failed to resolve to an activity.

AvailableDeepLinks.description: A suggestion to use deep links for a Robo run.

InAppPurchasesFound.description: Additional details of in-app purchases encountered during the crawl.

inAppPurchasesFlowsStarted.description: The total number of in-app purchases flows started.

inAppPurchasesFlowsExplored.description:
The total number of in-app purchases flows explored: how many times the
robo tries to buy a SKU.

RoboScriptExecution.description: Execution stats for a user-provided Robo script.

totalActions.description: The total number of actions in the Robo script.

successfulActions.description: The number of Robo script actions executed successfully.

stackTrace.description:
The stack trace of the ANR crash.
Optional.

ANR.description: Additional details for an ANR crash.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource that was ignored.

UsedRoboIgnoreDirective.description:
Additional details of a used Robo directive with an ignore action.
Note: This is a different scenario than unused directive.

screenId.description: The screen id of the elements

resourceName.description: Resource names of the overlapping screen elements

OverlappingUIElements.description:
A warning that Robo encountered a screen that has overlapping clickable
elements; this may indicate a potential UI issue.

EncounteredNonAndroidUiWidgetScreen.description:
Additional details about encountered screens with elements that are not
Android UI widgets.

distinctScreens.description: Number of encountered distinct screens with non Android UI widgets.

screenIds.description: Subset of screens which contain non Android UI widgets.

name: toolresults
title: Cloud Tool Results API

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

description: API to publish and access results from developer tools.
